12.59.text:
SUBJECT: So we've had this
ongoing debate, right, nature

15.93.text:
And it asks the question are
we pre-written beings, are we

19.83.text:
pre-determined beings,
do our genetics dictate

24.27.text:
our fate, right, or are we
made by our environment,

28.83.text:
are we molded by our experience,
does language structure how

32.51.text:
we see the world, does
culture dictate who we become,

36.37.text:
are we molded and shaped
by the unfolding dynamics

43.25.text:
This is sometimes
known as epigenetics,

45.45.text:
how literally things
that happen to you

47.83.text:
during your formative
years can transform

50.42.text:
how your genetic
structure is expressed.

55.39.text:
But recently this debate
has taken on new heights

58.41.text:
because some of
the new science--

60.25.text:
there's an article called
The Social Life of Genes that

62.54.text:
talked about this, which said
that the idea of epigenetics

65.11.text:
actually goes much farther,
and that experience

68.19.text:
throughout our lives affects
our genetic expression.

71.42.text:
And the doctor, the researcher
quoted in the piece, actually

74.65.text: the best way to describe it.

76.18.text:
He basically says, that our
cells, compose our bodies,

79.77.text:
are a technology for turning
experience into biology,

84.39.text:
that even the cognitive framing
that we give to an experience

93.54.text:
So that consciousness itself,
interpretation, storytelling,

97.63.text:
and framing, how we give
meaning to our lives,

100.80.text:
can actually have a real
effect at our genetic level,

104.84.text:
at the way our genetic
software expresses itself.

108.37.text:
And we've always heard
the bumper stickers that

110.47.text:
talk about the
power of the mind,

111.70.text:
or the power of
positive thinking,

112.65.text:
or the fact that we
can shape our reality,

114.74.text:
but this notion not just
effects genetic expression

118.16.text:
at one point in your life,
but throughout your life,

126.73.text:
I've said it before,
I'll say it again,

128.35.text: but we are as god's, my friends.

131.09.text:
And we might as
well get good at it.
